conclusion: Solve thermodynamic problem to find total heat transferred during process.
Ideal gas goes from State A (p = 3×10⁵ Pa, V = 1×10⁻³ m³) to State B (p = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 1×10⁻³ m³) to State C (p = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 3×10⁻³ m³).
Fourth image shows entire path with B-C segment highlighted, indicating analysis of complete A→B→C process.
A→B is an isochoric process with decreasing pressure.
B→C is an isobaric process with increasing volume.
Temperature at point B, T₂ = 100 K.
Heat transfer for process A→B, Q_AB = -300nR joules.
Temperature at point C, T₃ = 300 K.
Heat transfer for process B→C, Q_BC = 500nR joules.
Final answer: Total heat transferred to the gas is 200nR = 1662.8n joules.
